p:
Experimental data of electric current (I MFC) and voltage (V MFC) were automatically collected with a data acquisition system (DAS 5020; Jiehan Technology Corporation, Taiwan). For comparison with prior results, the external resistance of microbial fuel cells was intentionally set at 1 KΩ. Power density and current density of MFCs were calculated with the formulae below:
P density
=
V MFC
×
I MFC
A anode
,
I density
=
I MFC
A anode
,
where V MFC and I MFC could be directly measured with linear sweep voltammetry supported by a work station for electric chemistry analysis (Jiehan 5600, Jiehan Technology Corporation, Taiwan). The parameter A anode was the actual working area of the graphite anode.
